org.apache.kudu.test

Class KuduTestHarness

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
      • org.apache.kudu.test.KuduTestHarness
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.junit.rules.TestRule

    @InterfaceAudience.Public
 @InterfaceStability.Evolving
public class KuduTestHarness
extends org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
    A Junit Rule that manages a Kudu cluster and clients for testing. This rule also includes utility methods for the cluster and clients. 
     public static class TestFoo {

  @Rule
  public KuduTestHarness harness = new KuduTestHarness();

  ...
 }

      • getBaseClusterBuilder

        public static org.apache.kudu.test.cluster.MiniKuduCluster.MiniKuduClusterBuilder getBaseClusterBuilder()
        Returns the base MiniKuduClusterBuilder used when creating a KuduTestHarness with the default constructor. This is useful if you want to add to the default cluster setup.

      • killTabletLeader

        public void killTabletLeader(KuduTable table)
                      throws Exception
        Helper method to easily kill a tablet server that serves the given table's only tablet's leader. The currently running test case will be failed if there's more than one tablet, if the tablet has no leader after some retries, or if the tablet server was already killed. This method is thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        table - a KuduTable which will get its single tablet's leader killed.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • killTabletLeader

        public void killTabletLeader(org.apache.kudu.client.RemoteTablet tablet)
                      throws Exception
        Helper method to kill a tablet server that serves the given tablet's leader. The currently running test case will be failed if the tablet has no leader after some retries, or if the tablet server was already killed. This method is thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        tablet - a RemoteTablet which will get its leader killed
        Throws:
        Exception

      • killTabletLeader

        public void killTabletLeader(LocatedTablet tablet)
                      throws Exception
        Helper method to kill a tablet server that serves the given tablet's leader. The currently running test case will be failed if the tablet has no leader after some retries, or if the tablet server was already killed. This method is thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        tablet - a LocatedTablet which will get its leader killed
        Throws:
        Exception

      • findLeaderTabletServer

        public org.apache.kudu.client.HostAndPort findLeaderTabletServer(LocatedTablet tablet)
                                                          throws Exception
        Finds the RPC port of the given tablet's leader tserver.
        Parameters:
        tablet - a LocatedTablet
        Returns:
        the host and port of the given tablet's leader tserver
        Throws:
        Exception - if we are unable to find the leader tserver

      • killLeaderMasterServer

        public void killLeaderMasterServer()
                            throws Exception
        Helper method to easily kill the leader master. This method is thread-safe.
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is an error finding or killing the leader master.

      • findLeaderMasterServer

        public org.apache.kudu.client.HostAndPort findLeaderMasterServer()
                                                          throws Exception
        Find the host and port of the leader master.
        Returns:
        the host and port of the leader master
        Throws:
        Exception - if we are unable to find the leader master

      • restartTabletServer

        public void restartTabletServer(KuduTable table)
                         throws Exception
        Picks at random a tablet server that serves tablets from the passed table and restarts it.
        Parameters:
        table - table to query for a TS to restart
        Throws:
        Exception

      • restartTabletServer

        public void restartTabletServer(org.apache.kudu.client.RemoteTablet tablet)
                         throws Exception
        Kills a tablet server that serves the given tablet's leader and restarts it.
        Parameters:
        tablet - a RemoteTablet which will get its leader killed and restarted
        Throws:
        Exception

      • killAllMasterServers

        public void killAllMasterServers()
                          throws IOException
        Kills all the master servers. Does nothing to the servers that are already dead.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • startAllMasterServers

        public void startAllMasterServers()
                           throws IOException
        Starts all the master servers. Does nothing to the servers that are already running.
        Throws:
        IOException

        Throws:

      • resetClients

        public void resetClients()
                  throws IOException
        Resets the clients so that their state is completely fresh, including meta cache, connections, open tables, sessions and scanners, and propagated timestamp.
        Throws:
        IOException
